com.ibm.mqlight.api

Class SubscribeOptions.SubscribeOptionsBuilder

  • java.lang.Object
    • com.ibm.mqlight.api.SubscribeOptions.SubscribeOptionsBuilder
  • Enclosing class:
    SubscribeOptions

    public static class SubscribeOptions.SubscribeOptionsBuilder
extends Object
    A builder that creates instances of SubscribeOptions.

    • Method Detail

      • setAutoConfirm

        public SubscribeOptions.SubscribeOptionsBuilder setAutoConfirm(boolean autoConfirm)
        Determines whether the client automatically confirms the receipt of 'at least once' quality of service messages.
        Parameters:
        autoConfirm - When set to true (the default) the client will automatically confirm delivery of messages when after calling the appropriate DestinationListener#onMessage(NonBlockingClient, Object, Delivery) or DestinationListener#onMalformed(NonBlockingClient, Object, BytesDelivery, com.ibm.mqlight.api.DestinationListener.MalformedReason) method registered for the destination that the message was received from. When set to false, the application using the client is responsible for confirming the delivery of messages using the Delivery#confirm() method). autoConfirm is only applicable to 'at least once' quality of service (see #setQos(QOS))
        Returns:
        the instance of SubscribeOptionsBuilder that this method was invoked on.

      • setCredit

        public SubscribeOptions.SubscribeOptionsBuilder setCredit(int credit)
                                                   throws IllegalArgumentException
        Sets the maximum number of unconfirmed messages a client can have before the server will stop sending new messages to the client and require that it confirms some of the outstanding message deliveries in order to receive more messages.
        Parameters:
        credit - the credit value which must be >= 0. The default if this is not specified is 1024.
        Returns:
        the instance of SubscribeOptionsBuilder that this method was invoked on.
        Throws:
        IllegalArgumentException - if an invalid credit value is specified.

      • setQos

        public SubscribeOptions.SubscribeOptionsBuilder setQos(QOS qos)
                                                throws IllegalArgumentException
        The quality of service to use for delivering messages to the subscription. The default, if this option is not set, is: 'at most once'.
        Parameters:
        qos - The required quality of service. Cannot be null.
        Returns:
        the instance of SubscribeOptionsBuilder that this method was invoked on.
        Throws:
        IllegalArgumentException - if an invalid qos value is specified.

      • setShare

        public SubscribeOptions.SubscribeOptionsBuilder setShare(String shareName)
                                                  throws IllegalArgumentException
        The share argument supplied used when subscribing to a destination.
        Parameters:
        shareName - the share argument used to subscribe to a destination. The default is null which is interpreted as "do not subscribe to a shared destination - the destination is private to this client". When specified, the share name must not contain a colon (:) character.
        Returns:
        the instance of SubscribeOptionsBuilder that this method was invoked on.
        Throws:
        IllegalArgumentException - if an invalid shareName value is specified.

      • setTtl

        public SubscribeOptions.SubscribeOptionsBuilder setTtl(long ttl)
                                                throws IllegalArgumentException
        A time-to-live value, in milliseconds, that is applied to the destination that the client is subscribed to. This value will replace any previous value, if the destination already exists. Time to live starts counting down when there are no instances of a client subscribed to a destination. It is reset each time a new instance of the client subscribes to the destination. If time to live counts down to zero then MQ Light will delete the destination by discarding any messages held at the destination and not accruing any new messages.
        Parameters:
        ttl - a time to live value in milliseconds, the default being 0 - meaning the destination will be deleted as soon as there are no clients subscribed to it. This must be a positive value, and a maximum of 4294967295 (0xFFFFFFFF)
        Returns:
        the instance of SubscribeOptionsBuilder that this method was invoked on.
        Throws:
        IllegalArgumentException - if an invalid ttl value is specified.

      • build

        public SubscribeOptions build()
        Returns:
        an instance of SubscribeOptions based on the current settings of this builder.
